definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: The headmaster is calling off the names on his list.
sentences.chinese: 校長正在按名單依次唱名。
僕人唱名通報史密斯先生來訪。

sentences.english: The servant announced mr. and mrs. smith .
sentences.chinese: 僕人唱名報告“史密斯先生和夫人到”。

sentences.english: You'll meet sol-fa system problem in the solfeggio teaching first.
sentences.chinese: 在視唱練耳教學實踐中首先要遇到唱名法的問題。

sentences.english: Chapter I The introduction of solmization.
sentences.chinese: 第一章闡述唱名法的概論。

sentences.english: Solmisation has both the academic and practical meaning in curricular teaching of the sightsinging and ear training.
sentences.chinese: 唱名法在視唱練耳中具有理論和實踐意義。

sentences.english: In French, Spanish and Italian a system based on traditional sol-fa is used.
sentences.chinese: 在法國，西班牙和意大利，則運用建立在傳統唱名。

sentences.english: Chapter III The development of solmization and its application.
sentences.chinese: 第三章闡述唱名法的發展現狀與應用。

sentences.english: Roll-on left in the glove box on hot days will heat up and leak.
sentences.chinese: 唱名對遺留在手套箱對熱天會熱起來，泄漏。

sentences.english: Teaching by method of tonic solfa, students built up interval aural ability.
sentences.chinese: 以首調唱名法進行教學，有助於學生音程音感的建立。

definition: names of the notes of a musical scale (e.g. C, D, E or do, re, mi)
rising tone (phonetics, e.g. on a question in English)
a note on a musical scale
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
to notate music/to write a score
